context_bundle.summary: Unit testing: Test individual functions/classes in isolation. Characteristics: Fast (<1ms per test), isolated (no external dependencies), deterministic. Frameworks: Pytest (Python), Jest (JavaScript/TypeScript), JUnit (Java), xUnit (.NET), Mocha (Node.js). Patterns: AAA (Arrange, Act, Assert), Given-When-Then. Mock external dependencies (databases, APIs, file system). Test edge cases, happy path, error handling. Coverage target: 70-80% for production code.

onboarding.quick_start: Unit tests: Test single function/class in isolation. Structure: Arrange (setup), Act (execute), Assert (verify). Python (pytest): def test_add(): assert add(2, 3) == 5; assert add(-1, 1) == 0; assert add(0, 0) == 0. JavaScript (Jest): test('adds numbers', () => { expect(add(2, 3)).toBe(5); expect(add(-1, 1)).toBe(0); }). Mock dependencies: from unittest.mock import Mock; db = Mock(); db.query.return_value = []; result = get_users(db); assert result == []; db.query.assert_called_once(). Run: pytest (Python), npm test / jest (JS), dotnet test (.NET). Characteristics: Fast (100s-1000s tests/sec), no I/O, no network, no database. Test edge cases: empty input, null, max values, exceptions. AAA pattern: Arrange inputs -> Act on function -> Assert expected output.
common_patterns: Pytest: def test_calculate_total(): cart = Cart(); cart.add_item(Item('apple', 1.50), 2); assert cart.total() == 3.00
Jest: describe('Calculator', () => { test('multiplies numbers', () => { expect(multiply(3, 4)).toBe(12); }); test('handles zero', () => { expect(multiply(0, 5)).toBe(0); }); });
Mocking: from unittest.mock import patch; @patch('requests.get') def test_api_call(mock_get): mock_get.return_value.json.return_value = {'data': []}; result = fetch_data(); assert result == []
Parametrized tests (pytest): @pytest.mark.parametrize('input,expected', [(2, 4), (3, 9), (0, 0)]) def test_square(input, expected): assert square(input) == expected
Setup/teardown: @pytest.fixture def client(): return TestClient(); def test_endpoint(client): response = client.get('/'); assert response.status == 200
Edge cases: test_empty_list(), test_null_input(), test_max_integer(), test_negative_values()
